Definition: The "Five-foot way" is a unique feature of traditional shophouses in Singapore. It refers to a covered pedestrian pathway that is five feet wide, running along the storefront of these buildings. This was originally designed to protect pedestrians from the sun and rain, but also served as a space for commercial activities to take place. Today, the five-foot way remains a distinct characteristic of historic shophouses in Singapore and can be seen in Chinatown and other heritage areas.
